cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 600 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northeast and accelerate, moving toward the northern Gulf Coast Friday night, then racing across the southeastern U.S. and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast late Sunday–Monday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to the Ochlockonee River, FL and Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (tropical-storm watch areas east of the Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown, FL)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to the Ochlockonee River, FL and Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (tropical-storm warnings); Indian Pass to Clearwater Beach, FL (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast Friday–Saturday, then the Atlantic coast from Florida through the Carolinas and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained gale-force winds are unlikely at Baltimore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Chesapeake Bay from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain Sunday into early Monday could total 1–2 inches with locally higher amounts, enough for ponding on terminals but below major-flood thresholds.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and minor coastal flooding/rip currents along Maryland beaches; brief marine squalls possible in outer rain bands.
